intro: Cortusa insularis, commonly known as the Isle of Man bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Isle of Man. It features upright, branching stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically in shades of blue or violet. The plant has dark green, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland margins and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
